content:
• Friday, August 31, 2012
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +17.8%) closed with a huge gain on heavy volume. M&A speculation...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +17.8%) closed with a huge gain on heavy volume. M&A speculation fueled by IBM's Monday deal to buy fellow cloud HR software firm Kenexa is almost certainly the reason. On Tuesday, B. Riley argued Saba could be sold at a hefty premium to a larger cloud player such as Salesforce.com or Workday, or an IT giant such as H-P or Dell. Peers Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +2%) and Ultimate Software (ULTI +1.1%) had more modest gains. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • DDMGQ

    Animation services firm Digital Domain (DDMG -10.4%) fell hard today in the absence of major...

    Animation services firm Digital Domain (DDMG -10.4%) fell hard today in the absence of major news. This afternoon, the company announced an erroneous 400K-share trade was posted and subsequently removed from the tape, but that a 391.5K-share trade actually happened. Nearly a million DDMG shares were traded today, more than 4x the daily average. CEO John Textor recently disclosed he's thinking of buying the company, in light of its plunging stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • MDVN

    Medivation (NASDAQ:MDVN) resumed trading just before the close, up 7.6% on the back of the FDA...

    Medivation (NASDAQ:MDVN) resumed trading just before the close, up 7.6% on the back of the FDA announcement of an early approval for it and Astellas Pharma's enzalutamide capsules for the treatment of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries (CF +1.5%) says there was no significant damage from Hurricane Isaac to its...

    CF Industries (CF +1.5%) says there was no significant damage from Hurricane Isaac to its Donaldsonville, La., nitrogen complex. The maker of nitrogen and phosphate fertilizer products had shut down production as a precautionary measure on Aug. 28 and has now initiated the process of restarting all operating units.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENB

    Spectra Energy (SE -0.9%) is downgraded to Equal Weight by Barclays, which cuts its NGL price...

    Spectra Energy (SE -0.9%) is downgraded to Equal Weight by Barclays, which cuts its NGL price forecast. The firm now expects an EPS CAGR of 5.4% for the three years ending 2014; combined with a 3.9% yield, it estimates a total return proposition of 9.3%. SE trades at a 2013E P/E multiple of 16.8x and 9x EV/EBITDA, more in line with a reduced rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +4.6%) rallies after launching a new freemium title for its Blood & Glory...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +4.6%) rallies after launching a new freemium title for its Blood & Glory mobile game franchise. Glu boasts Blood & Glory: Legend, available on iOS and Android, offers "umatched high-definition visuals." The original Blood & Glory has received over 140K reviews in the App Store, with the average reviewer giving it 5 stars. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +3.8%) announces price increases for all its flat rolled stainless steel...

    AK Steel (AKS +3.8%) announces price increases for all its flat rolled stainless steel products. Barclays maintains an Overweight rating on the stock which "has become the most disliked company in an already unfavored sector," seeing the AKS story turning from cash burn and liquidity concerns to one of positive earnings in the coming months.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI +3.6%) trades higher after announcing: 1) Taiwan's MediaTek will integrate Rovi's...

    Rovi (ROVI +3.6%) trades higher after announcing: 1) Taiwan's MediaTek will integrate Rovi's DivX Plus streaming tech into its Blu-ray and HDTV chipsets, are used by many Asian OEMs. 2) Chinese low-end TV maker Hisense will include DivX Plus support  in an upcoming line of "Smart TVs." 3) A new retail solution for converting DVD and Blu-ray video into online copies, via Hollywood's controversial UltraViolet platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • MDVN

    The FDA has given early approval to enzalutimide, a new prostate-cancer drug developed jointly...

    The FDA has given early approval to enzalutimide, a new prostate-cancer drug developed jointly by Medivation (MDVN +1.4%) and Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY). The drug - which was approved to treat men with prostate cancer that has spread or returned after prior treatment with another drug, docetaxel - will be sold under the brand name Xtandi. Dendreon (DNDN -0.6%), whose already struggling with lagging sales of its own prostrate drug, Provenge, trades down on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +4.3%), rallying again on optimism about its new search engine, is spending...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +4.3%), rallying again on optimism about its new search engine, is spending $218M to acquire a Beijing office complex. Qihoo plans to use the complex as its new HQ, and will pay for it via three cash payments to be made from 2012-2014. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • NMR

    Nomura Holdings (NMR +4%) shares are surging today on a WSJ report that it’s planning to...

    Nomura Holdings (NMR +4%) shares are surging today on a WSJ report that it’s planning to cut costs by $1B next fiscal year, in the first indication of how Japan's biggest brokerage is changing course under new management. The cuts come after another $1B in cost reductions in its wholesale business implemented earlier this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX -2.8%) says its 247K bbl/day Alliance Refinery in Belle Chasse, La., remains...

    Phillips 66 (PSX -2.8%) says its 247K bbl/day Alliance Refinery in Belle Chasse, La., remains shut down and without power following Hurricane Isaac. Floodwater remains in the refinery but is receding and no more than two feet high, debunking rumors it was far deeper. PSX's nearby 239K bbl/day Lake Charles Refinery remains in operation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • FLDM

    Shares of Fluidigm (FLDM +2.8%) are on the rise today after Mizuho Securities initiates coverage...

    Shares of Fluidigm (FLDM +2.8%) are on the rise today after Mizuho Securities initiates coverage of the firm with a Buy rating and a $17 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +6.7%) moves up today after announcing a registered direct...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +6.7%) moves up today after announcing a registered direct offering , selling 6.4M shares to funds managed QVT Financial for $6.57 each. Net proceeds from the sale are expected to be around $41.8M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Shares of Zumiez (ZUMZ -15.5%) can't shake off the retailer's Q2 miss and gloomy outlook for Q3....

    Shares of Zumiez (ZUMZ -15.5%) can't shake off the retailer's Q2 miss and gloomy outlook for Q3. In an earnings CC, execs say the back-to-school season is shifting later into the year for the company and that product margins are forecast to be flat for the rest of the year. Though Zumiez is still in a growth mode, the tone on the call is cautious with protecting margins a focus. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE +2.5%) says it will sell 10 large ore carriers for $600M to Turkish company Polaris...

    Vale (VALE +2.5%) says it will sell 10 large ore carriers for $600M to Turkish company Polaris Shipping as part of its strategy to optimize its asset portfolios. The company says the sale preserves its capacity of maritime transportation of iron ore, since the vessels will be chartered back by Vale under long-term charter contracts, thus avoiding ownership and operational risks.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • MIPS

    Will MIPS' (MIPS +3.8%) efforts to find a buyer soon bear fruit? Benchmark's Gary Mobley thinks...

    Will MIPS' (MIPS +3.8%) efforts to find a buyer soon bear fruit? Benchmark's Gary Mobley thinks so: he claims a meeting with management left him remaining confident the CPU core developer/patent holder's "assets will be broken up and sold within the next four months." Mobley, who has a $10 PT, sees U.K.-based graphics core developer Imagination (OTCPK:IGNMF) as the most logical buyer, but thinks a bid from ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH), CEVA, or Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) is also possible.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +4.5%) has enjoyed substantial recent insider purchases, according to Insider...

    Molycorp (MCP +4.5%) has enjoyed substantial recent insider purchases, according to Insider Monkey. Director Ross Bhappu’s Resource Capital bought 2.5M shares at an average $10/share, CEO Mark Smith directly purchased 50K shares, and the company’s CFO and another board member also added shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • CASC-OLD

    Cascade (CASC-OLD -1%) slips after its Q2 missed on both counts late yesterday. Net earnings...

    Cascade (CASC-OLD -1%) slips after its Q2 missed on both counts late yesterday. Net earnings fell 8.8% as currency fluctuations mostly offset sales growth and its effective tax rate rose. Gross margin fell to 30.8% from 31.9%. Total shipments fell 2% on a 19% decline in shipments to China. However, shipments improved elsewhere: Asia-Pacific +14%, Americas +2% and Europe +4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • LLNW

    Limelight (LLNW -5.6%) dives after a patent infringement suit filed by bigger rival Akamai (AKAM...

    Limelight (LLNW -5.6%) dives after a patent infringement suit filed by bigger rival Akamai (AKAM +0.9%) is remanded to a lower court for further judgment. In '08, a jury found Limelight guilty of infringing 3 Akamai patents and awarded Akamai $45.5M. But the verdict was thrown out by a district court judge, and the judge's ruling upheld by a federal appeals court.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • TSYS

    TeleCommunication Systems (TSYS +8.3%) jumps on an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan. After...

    TeleCommunication Systems (TSYS +8.3%) jumps on an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan. After getting crushed in spring, the provider of E9-1-1 call routing services has rallied over the last 5 weeks. The company acquired microDATA GIS, a provider of next-gen E9-1-1 services, in early July.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • RNO

    Rhino Resource Partners (RNO +2.6%) is Dividend Channel's top dividend-paying Rock Stock, noting...

    Rhino Resource Partners (RNO +2.6%) is Dividend Channel's top dividend-paying Rock Stock, noting RNO's attractive valuation metrics and strong profitability metrics. The report also cites RNO's strong quarterly dividend history and favorable long-term multi-year growth rates in key fundamental data points.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK +17.3%), is taking off thanks to a strong FQ2 beat and decent guidance. During...

    Splunk (SPLK +17.3%), is taking off thanks to a strong FQ2 beat and decent guidance. During Splunk's earnings call, execs talked up the evolution of the company's machine data software into a platform for 3rd-party apps in areas such as security, data integration, and app monitoring. But Drexel Hamilton and UBS are reiterating neutral stances, and CLSA a bearish one, due to Splunk's lofty multiples.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • CAS

    Metals distributor A.M. Castle (CAS +6.2%) adopts a poison pill provision with a 10% trigger to...

    Metals distributor A.M. Castle (CAS +6.2%) adopts a poison pill provision with a 10% trigger to thwart potential takeovers by giving other shareholders the right to buy more shares. The decision comes after the company last week found itself in the crosshairs of private equity firm Platinum Equity and larger Chicago-based metals distributor Ryerson, who revealed building a 6.1% stake in CAS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM

  • Gold, silver, and crude are believers - all sharply higher following what's now being...

    Gold, silver, and crude are believers - all sharply higher following what's now being interpreted as Bernanke setting the stage for more stimulus at the September FOMC meeting. GLD +1.3%, SLV +2.5%, USO +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 11 Comments
  • GLCNF

    Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF) has expressed interest in Alcoa's (AA +1.6%) aluminum plant on the island...

    Glencore (OTCPK:GLCNF) has expressed interest in Alcoa's (AA +1.6%) aluminum plant on the island of Sardinia, Italy's industry minister says, and the companies will meet again will labor and ministry officials Sept. 5. AA plans to close the money-losing factory by November unless a buyer is found.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (LAYN -0.7%) continues to weaken off yesterday's midday downgrade by UBS from...

    Layne Christensen (LAYN -0.7%) continues to weaken off yesterday's midday downgrade by UBS from Neutral to Sell. The firm says that earnings are likely to be hit by weakness in its mining and municipal water markets plus continued declines in natural gas prices. FY13 EPS estimates were cut from $1.40 to $1.30 and FY14 from $1.90 to $1.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP +3.1%) is trading higher in the wake of today's warning and guidance cut, The bad...

    Suntech (STP +3.1%) is trading higher in the wake of today's warning and guidance cut, The bad news was apparently baked in following the latest raft of disappointing earnings reports from Chinese solar names. Nonetheless, Suntech continues to trade below $1, as investors fret over the impact of a $662M fraud allegedly committed by a Suntech-affiliated solar investment firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +6.2%) take another turn higher after investors see an EPA ruling that...

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +6.2%) take another turn higher after investors see an EPA ruling that allows manufacturers to sell non-compliant diesel engines by paying a fine as a positive for the company. Despite the victory of sorts for Navistar, Herb Greenberg warns that we haven't heard the last from truck makers on the issue.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -4%) makes new lows after BMO and Stifel join BofA in cutting their targets. BMO,...

    Facebook (FB -4%) makes new lows after BMO and Stifel join BofA in cutting their targets. BMO, reiterating an Underperform, says its media spending checks turned up two negatives for every positive, and that many ad execs used the word "pause" when discussing Facebook campaigns. The only Facebook underwriter to start coverage with a bearish stance, BMO now forecasts Q3 revenue of $1.2B, below a $1.24B consensus. (more from Facebook advertisers: I, II, III)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 10 Comments
  • HMY

    Shares of Harmony Gold (HMY -2.8%) and AngloGold Ashanti (AU -1.1%) fall in tandem with fellow...

    Shares of Harmony Gold (HMY -2.8%) and AngloGold Ashanti (AU -1.1%) fall in tandem with fellow South African miner Gold Fields (GFI -3.5%), which said workers at its KDC mine have been engaged in a wildcat strike since Wednesday, with the loss of two day shifts and two night shifts.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • CS

    Credit Suisse (NYSE:CS) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at ING following the Swiss bank’s...

    Credit Suisse (NYSE:CS) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at ING following the Swiss bank’s announcement of a plan to improve its capital. “While the plan leads to a substantial increase in shares outstanding, it also reduces uncertainty around Credit Suisse’s share count and improves valuation through a lower deduction for capital shortfalls,” ING says. CS +3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC) and AMR (AAMRQ.PK) announce a non-disclosure agreement, in an indication that a...

    US Airways (LCC) and AMR (AAMRQ.PK) announce a non-disclosure agreement, in an indication that a merger may be back on track. LCC +6.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • UUP

    Somebody thinks the Fed is about to take steps to reverse the recent shrinkage in its balance...

    Somebody thinks the Fed is about to take steps to reverse the recent shrinkage in its balance sheet, the Dollar Bull ETF (NYSEARCA:UUP) is -0.8% premarket, a significant drop for the slow-moving index.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SPLK

    Premarket gainers: SPLK +15%. TSYS +12%. OVTI +11%. STEM +8%. SAI +8%. LCC +6%. Losers: ZUMZ...

    Premarket gainers: SPLK +15%. TSYS +12%. OVTI +11%. STEM +8%. SAI +8%. LCC +6%.
    Losers: ZUMZ -10%. GFI] -6%. HMY -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM) +8.6% premarket on top of yesterday's 21% spike after the smallcap company...

    StemCells (STEM) +8.6% premarket on top of yesterday's 21% spike after the smallcap company unveiled a plan to provide data from a Phase I/II clinical trial testing its stem-cell therapy to be used in the treatment of chronic spinal-cord injuries at the International Spinal Cord Society's annual scientific meeting.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) move up 1.6% premarket after Google appears set to stop its...

    Shares of Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) move up 1.6% premarket after Google appears set to stop its Google TV ads programs to focus on web initiatives. A renewed push by consumers away from TV into digital content options could set up nicely for Netflix.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $4 price target at Dahlman...

    Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $4 price target at Dahlman Rose. The firm says it has not ruled out further challenges as TC looks to ramp up Mt. Milligan, but it believes the company has adequate capital to complete the project, which should generate substantial profits in 2014. TC +4.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • GFI

    Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) -5.8% premarket on news that the 12K employees of the East Section of the...

    Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) -5.8% premarket on news that the 12K employees of the East Section of the KDC mine in South Africa have been engaging in an "unlawful and unprotected strike" since Wednesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • NAV

    The EPA will allow Navistar (NYSE:NAV) to sell engines that don't comply with federal emission...

    The EPA will allow Navistar (NYSE:NAV) to sell engines that don't comply with federal emission standards by paying a fine of $3,775 per engine, nearly double the $1,919 it had been paying but less than some had expected. The company seems pleased: "We can now provide our dealers and customers with clarity and certainty as we transition to our clean engine technology." NAV +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 3 Comments
  • GLW

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) is upgraded to Outperform with a $16 price target by Oppenheimer's...

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) is upgraded to Outperform with a $16 price target by Oppenheimer's Andrew Uerkwitz, who says a day spent at company HQ has "(given) us confidence in our new found view." Catalysts: Moderating display glass prices as volumes rebound, favorable dynamics in other segments, and a potential dividend increase. Shares +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    It's obvious day today as Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) has its price target cut to $23 from $35 at BAML,...

    It's obvious day today as Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) has its price target cut to $23 from $35 at BAML, which cites future lockup concerns. The next big day expiration day is November 14. Shares +1.2% premarket. Take that Merrill Lynch. Far more ominous for Facebook: "Many are tired of (it)," says Jim Cramer. "When you drop off kids to school, you learn they like Twitter a heck of a lot more than Facebook."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 AM | 3 Comments

  • European shares buck the overnight trend in the U.S. and Asia and find themselves higher in...

    European shares buck the overnight trend in the U.S. and Asia and find themselves higher in early trading. Maybe there's new hope that Ben Bernanke will hand out the candy after all, bringing sparkling growth to the U.S., reversing China's slowdown and lifting the eurozone out of its debt-induced haze. Or maybe not. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.6%, London +0.1%, Paris +0.5%, Frankfurt +0.2%, Madrid +1%, Milan +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 AM

  • Asian shares are mostly lower following more weak data out of Japan, particularly industrial...

    Asian shares are mostly lower following more weak data out of Japan, particularly industrial production, and as Indian economic growth languishes near three-year lows. And then there's the long-awaited Ben Bernanke speech today at Jackson Hole. Japan -1.6%, Hong Kong -0.3%, China +0.1%, India -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 AM
